Key Match Events: Kwadwo Duah scored his first international goal after 12 minutes
Michel Aebischer doubled the lead on the stroke of half-time with a superb curling shot from outside the box
Barnabás Varga scored in the 66th minute for Hungary
Breel Embolo sealed the win after another Hungarian error in stoppage time
Pre-Game Insights: Hungary were billed as the tournament's dark horses
Switzerland were desperate for a strong start to the tournament after scraping through a weak group in a dismal qualifying campaign
Post-Match Reflections: Swiss coach Murat Yakin said 'I liken football to chess and today we got our tactics right'
Hungary coach Marco Rossi said 'The first half was very bad... we were too passive'
Granit Xhaka performed a vital role in the victory, controlling the pace of play, delivering pinpoint passes and twice coming close to scoring late goals
Miscellaneous Highlights: Breel Embolo was fit again after injury and scored on his return
Kwadwo Duah and Michel Aebischer were brought back into the Switzerland side and their selection proved inspired
Hungary's start to their third successive European Championship was disappointing
Switzerland made a commanding 3-1 win over a blunder-prone Hungary
Others: The match was played at RheinEnergieSTADION in Köln, Germany
